## Structured data extraction

A large part of Web information extraction requires the knowledge of natural language processing techniques such as text pre-processing, information extraction (entity extraction, relationship extraction, coreference resolution), sentiment analysis, text categorization/classification (irbook 13), language models (irbook 12) and others. These techniques are covered by the selective Natural language processing course taught by prof. dr. Marko Robnik Šikonja. Therefore we introduce these techniques on a shallow level and rather focus on web-related extraction only. For introduction to natural language techniques please see the proposed literature [@liu2011] (Chapter 11), [@manning2008] (Chapters 12, 13, 15-17, 20), [@aggarwal2012] (Chapters 1-8, 12-14).
